abstract: Has violence disappeared -- or just disappeared from public view?

lead_paragraph: In my post last week on Steven Pinker's "The Better Angels of Our Nature," I mentioned John Gray's hostile review of the book without citing what I thought was its most effective passage. It comes when Gray takes up Pinker's discussion of the post-1980s decline in American crime rates - a decline driven, in part, by mass incarceration on an extraordinary scale:
